title: Aliyu gifts 1,000 Saudi Riyadh to each Sokoto Hajj pilgrim

author: iBahia
title: Igreja da Boa Viagem Ã© fechada apÃ³s recomendaÃ§Ã£o do Iphan - iBahia
text:
Os administradores da
Igreja de Nossa Senhora da Boa Viagem, um dos principais templos de Salvador, decidiram fechar o local apÃ³s o Instituto do PatrimÃ´nio HistÃ³rico e ArtÃ­stico Nacional (Iphan) realizar duas vistorias nesta semana e emitir uma recomendaÃ§Ã£o. A parÃ³quia confirmou a decisÃ£o em suas redes sociais na Ãºltima quarta-feira (12).
Conforme a parÃ³quia, as inspeÃ§Ãµes foram conduzidas como medida preventiva, apÃ³s o desabamento parcial do teto da Igreja de SÃ£o Francisco, conhecida como "igreja de ouro", ocorrido em 5 de fevereiro â€“ incidente que resultou na morte de uma turista e deixou cinco pessoas feridas.
Leia tambÃ©m:
A principal preocupaÃ§Ã£o apontada pelo Iphan foi a situaÃ§Ã£o do teto da igreja, cuja construÃ§Ã£o foi concluÃ­da em 1743 e tombada em 1938, estando atualmente em condiÃ§Ãµes precÃ¡rias. A TV Bahia entrou em contato com o Iphan para obter esclarecimentos sobre as vistorias, mas nÃ£o obteve resposta atÃ© a Ãºltima atualizaÃ§Ã£o desta reportagem.
A Igreja de Nossa Senhora da Boa Viagem Ã© conhecida por abrigar a imagem do Bom Jesus dos Navegantes e por ser o ponto de partida da embarcaÃ§Ã£o Galeota GratidÃ£o do Povo, que realiza o transporte durante a tradicional procissÃ£o marÃ­tima em 1Â° de janeiro, na festa de Bom Jesus dos Navegantes.
Enquanto o templo permanecer interditado, as celebraÃ§Ãµes e demais atividades da parÃ³quia serÃ£o realizadas no SalÃ£o Hugo Rossini.
Homenagem Ã s vÃ­timas
Na terÃ§a-feira (11), uma missa de sÃ©timo dia homenageou a turista de SÃ£o Paulo Giulia Panchoni Righetto, que morreu aos 26 anos apÃ³s o desabamento da "igreja de ouro". A cerimÃ´nia foi realizada em um templo ao lado do imÃ³vel, no Centro HistÃ³rico.
AlÃ©m de fiÃ©is, estiveram presentes os freis que respondem pela "igreja de ouro". Eles presidiram a missa. A homenagem tambÃ©m integrou os cinco feridos no acidente.
O caso segue sob investigaÃ§Ã£o e a igreja continua interditada pela Defesa Civil de Salvador. NÃ£o hÃ¡ ainda um prazo para a conclusÃ£o do inquÃ©rito.
Na segunda-feira (10), a PolÃ­cia Federal assumiu a investigaÃ§Ã£o integral do desabamento. Antes, a PF dividia as funÃ§Ãµes com a PolÃ­cia Civil da Bahia, que, neste perÃ­odo, ficou responsÃ¡vel por ouvir testemunhas do desabamento.
No entanto, por se tratar de um imÃ³vel tomado pelo Iphan, o trabalho serÃ¡ concentrado no Ã³rgÃ£o federal. Com isso, os depoimentos colhidos pela PC passarÃ£o para a PF, que tocarÃ¡ o caso. O processo de realizaÃ§Ã£o da perÃ­cia ainda estÃ¡ em andamento.
TambÃ©m na segunda, o Iphan revelou que a igreja recebeu a Ãºltima vistoria tÃ©cnica em maio de 2024. Na ocasiÃ£o, nÃ£o foram identificados indÃ­cios de problemas estruturais que pudessem provocar o desabamento da forraÃ§Ã£o do teto do templo, como aconteceu no dia 5 de fevereiro.
O Iphan informou ainda que realizarÃ¡ a contrataÃ§Ã£o das obras emergenciais que englobarÃ£o escoramento, estabilizaÃ§Ã£o, acesso e seguranÃ§a do monumento e dos trabalhadores envolvidos.
Ainda nessa etapa, conforme o instituto, serÃ£o realizados os trabalhos de diagnÃ³stico, triagem, catalogaÃ§Ã£o, higienizaÃ§Ã£o, proteÃ§Ã£o e armazenagem das estruturas e bens artÃ­sticos que serÃ£o restaurados e remontados em uma segunda etapa.
AUTOR AUTOR

author: RenÃ© S. Kahn, MD, PhD
title: PREDiCTOR Study to Assess the Effectiveness of AI in Producing Psychiatric Objective Measures
text:
News
Video
Author(s):
A new study from Mount Sinai Health System and IBM Research is investigating the use of AI in developing objective measures for psychiatric diagnoses.
RenÃ© S. Kahn, MD, PhD, is the Chair of Psychiatry at Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai, and has spent his career working in psychiatry after training in both psychiatry and neurology. Kahnâ€™s research focuses on schizophrenia, mainly working in brain imaging and clinical trials comparing various medications in patients with schizophrenia. Mount Sinai announced in September 2024 that Kahn would be 1 of 3 investigators leading a new study, joining Cheryl Corcoran, MD, and Guillermo Cecchi, PhD. The Phenotypes Reimagined to Define Clinical Treatment and Outcome Research (PREDiCTOR) study aims to leverage advances in artificial intelligence (AI) to address the lack of objective measures in psychiatry.1 A press release from Mount Sinai said the study will be conducted in collaboration with researchers from Harvard, Johns Hopkins, Columbia, and Carnegie Mellon universities, as well as Deliberate AI. Kahn sat down with Psychiatric Times to discuss the study and the potential AI has for future clinical use.
â€œThe problem in psychiatry is that most of our assessments are subjective based on the conversation we have with the patient, based on the interpretation of that conversation, and based on our psychiatric interview, which again, is subjective,â€ Kahn said. Kahn said there is a feeling that AI can help develop objective measures that other fields of medicine have when diagnosing a patient. A recording device will be used to record the psychiatric interview, which will be fed to the AI program to predict the outcome in psychiatric patients who make the first visit to the psychiatric outpatient clinic. A press release from Mount Sinai said the study will incorporate behavioral data from clinical interviews, at-home data captured on smartphones, and cognitive testing. "The team will use objective, scalable, and cost-effective measurements to define novel clinical signatures that can be used for individual-level prediction and clinical decision-making in treating mental health disorders," the press release said.1
The study is being funded by a $20 million grant from the National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH). The study has 3 clinically relevant, hard outcomes that investigators are interested in: is the patient coming back for treatment, are they being hospitalized, and are they going to the emergency room for any issue. Kahn said the study will be using outpatient clinics in the Mount Sinai system, with 4 hospitals, 8 clinics, 4 adult clinics, and 4 child and adolescent clinics. Eligible patients include those between the ages of 15 and 45 who come in for their first outpatient visit. The study will use 2 samples, with a training sample of 1500 subjects and a validation sample of 600 subjects, totaling 2100 participants.
Kahn said the biggest challenge investigators anticipated was patients' willingness to be recorded, but a pilot study with 31 participants found that 29 of the 31 included gave consent. â€œThe other issue is that also the provider, the clinicians, need to provide consent because they will be part of the recording,â€ Kahn said. Investigators did not do a pilot study for this aspect, but Kahn said it was reassuring to see how willing patients were to be involved.
Dr Kahn is the Esther and Joseph Klingenstein Professor, System Chair of Psychiatry, and Inaugural Director of the Blau Center at the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai.
1. Mount Sinai Health System and IBM Research launch effort that leverages artificial intelligence and behavior data to improve mental health care for young people. Press release. Mount Sinai. September 12, 2024. Accessed February 27, 2025. https://www.mountsinai.org/about/newsroom/2024/mount-sinai-health-system-and-ibm-research-launch-effort-that-leverages-artificial-intelligence-and-behavioral-data-to-improve-mental-health-care-for-young-people

author: elEconomista.es
title: Â¿QuÃ© tienen en comÃºn MarÃ­a Pombo y Bayona? "Â¡Bienvenido a la familia!", le desea la instagramer
text: [Ãšltima hora en elEconomista.es15](/slices/web-slice.php?modulo=392) Â¿QuÃ© tienen en comÃºn MarÃ­a Pombo, superestrella de Instagram, y Juan Antonio Bayona, uno de los directores mÃ¡s importantes del cine espaÃ±ol con tÃ­tulos como La Sociedad de la nieve, Lo Imposible y Un monstruo viene a verme? Mucho. Tienen mucho en comÃºn. El realizador acaba de unirse a la agencia de comunicaciÃ³n Vertical Group, en su divisiÃ³n de cine, fundada por Marc MÃ¡rquez, Jaime MartÃ­nez Recasens y Alex MÃ¡rquez. "Estamos encantados de comenzar un nuevo viaje apoyando el talento de la industria cinematogrÃ¡fica, desarrollando marcas personales y generando valor global mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de las audiencias principales". AsÃ­ han anunciado desde la agencia el fichaje del director. Una de las primeras en felicitarle ha sido la modelo e instagramer MarÃ­a Pombo, que le ha lanzado un cariÃ±oso "Bienvenido a la familia". La influencer, que cuenta con 3,2 millones de seguidores, fichÃ³ por la misma agencia el aÃ±o pasado para llevar la divisiÃ³n de creadores de contenido en redes. Con solo dos aÃ±os de trayectoria, Vertical Group es una potente agencia de comunicaciÃ³n y representaciÃ³n de deportistas. Se encarga de crear contenido, de generar valor de marca y ganar impacto en las audiencias. TambiÃ©n, gestiona la imagen, la publicidad y los patrocinios. Tras el paso de MarÃ­a Pombo, llega a la empresa Bayona en la divisiÃ³n volcada en la industria del cine y los artistas. El director es un grande entre los mÃ¡s grandes. En 2018 fue elegido por Spielberg para dirigir Jurassic World: el reino caÃ­do. Relacionados [Marta Pombo se adapta a la rutina tras el ingreso en la UCI de su melliza y muestra su cuerpo postparto: "Milagro"](//www.eleconomista.es/informalia/famosos/noticias/12985322/09/24/marta-pombo-se-adapta-a-la-rutina-tras-el-ingreso-en-la-uci-de-su-melliza-y-muestra-su-cuerpo-postparto-milagro.html) [MarÃ­a Pombo se pronuncia sobre la ruptura de Ãlvaro Morata y Alice Campello: "Les deseo lo mejor"](//www.eleconomista.es/informalia/famosos/noticias/12985253/09/24/maria-pombo-se-pronuncia-sobre-la-ruptura-de-alvaro-morata-y-alice-campello-no-creo-que-sume-nada-bueno.html) [El encuentro de la familia y las hermanas Pombo tras el ingreso en la UCI de la melliza de Marta: "Respiramos tranquilos"](//www.eleconomista.es/informalia/famosos/noticias/12980379/09/24/el-encuentro-de-la-familia-y-las-hermanas-pombo-tras-el-ingreso-en-la-uci-de-la-melliza-de-marta-respiramos-tranquilos.html) [El corazÃ³n 'partÃ­o' de Marta Pombo: vuelve a casa con una de sus mellizas, la otra se queda en la UCI](//www.eleconomista.es/informalia/famosos/noticias/12973543/09/24/el-corazon-partio-de-marta-pombo-vuelve-a-casa-con-una-de-sus-mellizas-la-otra-se-queda-en-la-uci.html)

author: Ashraf Hendricks
title: Community project crochets recycled plastics into colourful bags | GroundUp
text:
Community project crochets recycled plastics into colourful bags
Re.Bag.Re.Use supports 21 women from Imizamo Yethu and other communities across Cape Town
Ashraf Hendricks
|
Bags, sun hats, placemats and footstools. These are just some of the products that Re.Bag.Re.Use, a Hout Bay community initiative, makes with recycled plastic bags and old VHS cassette tapes.
Founder Regine le Roux says she started the initiative four years ago during the covid lockdowns. They have since repurposed over one ton of plastic - the equivalent weight of â€œ8 baby elephantsâ€ - to create about 1,700 items.
â€œEach handcrafted product helps to keep plastic out of the environment and landfill sites,â€ says le Roux.
They wanted to solve the problem of having â€œcommunities filled with plasticâ€ while using peopleâ€™s creativity to create income streams.
The process is simple, says le Roux. They cut up the plastic into strips to roll it into a ball of â€˜plarnâ€™. This can then be crocheted in the same way as yarn. Each ball of â€˜plarnâ€™ produces more than 10 bags.
She first got the idea for the bags after seeing mats that were made out of plastic bags.
The project supports 21 women from Imizamo Yethu and other communities across Cape Town. They work from home and get paid immediately once the product is complete. The products are then labelled and added to their website catalogue for purchase. They are also sold at seasonal craft markets, pop-ups or from The Collective, an artisan store in Hout Bay.
When Mejury Kazingizi started working with Re.Bag.Re.Use about two years ago, she was a cutter and could not crochet. Now sheâ€™s able to complete a bag in a couple of hours. She says that learning to use the crochet hooks was challenging.
But she adds that she likes working on a project that also â€œhelps the environmentâ€ and takes great pride in seeing her work being worn in public. â€œYou can repurpose somethingâ€¦from nothing.â€
When sheâ€™s not crocheting, Kazingizi earns a living as a domestic worker in Camps Bay.
Le Roux says that the majority of the plastic bags are donated by their sponsor, Blue Ribbon, but the community also collect bags for them. â€œWeâ€™ll use any soft plastic as long as itâ€™s clean.â€
Le Roux says they would like to expand the project in the future. The project is also active in Koedoespoort in Pretoria.
The project has won numerous awards. A portion of every sale is donated to the Neighbourhood Old Age Home (NOAH) and the SPCA animal rescue.

author: 24horas
title: Rescatan a hombre atrapado en auto cubierto en nieve en Farellones | 24horas
text: [Carabineros de Farellones](/carabineros) junto a la Municipalidad de Lo Barnechea y el equipo de vialidad de Valle Nevado rescataron a un hombre que se encontraba atrapado en el interior de un vehÃ­culo, el cual estaba volcado y cubierto de [nieve](/24horas/site/tag/port/all/tagport_1085_1.html) tras una avalancha en la en la Ruta G-251. Cerca de las 19:30 horas del viernes, Carabineros recibiÃ³ el reporte de una persona desaparecida tras posiblemente ser arrastada por un desplazamiento de nieve en el sector del kilÃ³metro 7 de la ruta que une la localidad de Farellones con el Centro Invernal Valle Nevado. De acuerdo con el coronel Gerardo Aravena, prefecto Santiago Andes, personal policial concurriÃ³ de forma inmediata al lugar. Los mencionados equipos utilizaron maquinaria pesada con motivo de despejar la ruta, que se encontraba con grandes cantidades de nieve. Al llegar al lugar, se toparon con un minibÃºs "que se encontraba aislado con 11 personas en su interior, que correspondÃ­an a trabajadores del Centro Invernal y turistas (...) de acuerdo a la versiÃ³n de ellos, habÃ­a una persona que habÃ­a sido efectivamente arrastrada por un desplazamiento de nieve ocurrido horas antes", dijo Aravena. Carabineros procediÃ³ a buscar por las laderas del cerro, pudiendo ubicar al vehÃ­culo. Verificaron que en el interior estaba la persona desaparecida, a quien rescataron y trasladaron al Centro Invernal del Cerro Valle Nevado con la finalidad de ser atendida por especialistas mÃ©dicos para verificar su estado de salud. Carabineros graba momento del rescate en Farellones El video del rescate fue capturada por [Carabineros](/carabineros) y subido a X (Twitter), en el cual se ve el auto volcado y cubierto de nieve. Luego de que el personal que se encontraba en el lugar se encargara de despejar la nieve para facilitar el procedimiento, Carabineros pudo abrir el vehÃ­culo para rescatar a quien se encontraba atrapado en el interior. ðŸš¨â€” Carabineros de Chile (@Carabdechile) [#Urgente]: Carabineros de [#Farellones]junto a la Municipalidad de [@lo_barnechea]y equipo de vialidad de [#ValleNevado], logran el rescate de una persona extraviada producto del deslizamiento de nieve en la Ruta G-251. La persona se encontraba en el interior de un vehÃ­culo volcadoâ€¦ [pic.twitter.com/SMQgegBDaV] [June 22, 2024] Revisa mÃ¡s momentos del rescate

author: Elizabeth Whitten
title: 'Tremendous' effort keeps wildfire south of Churchill River, says N.L. Hydro | CBC News
text: [NL](/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador)Â·Updated 11 fires now burning, with one on Newfoundland's west coast Fire suppression activities efforts Thursday have kept the wildfire near Churchill Falls to the south banks of the river for the time being, says Newfoundland and Labrador Hydro. "As a result of this tremendous suppression effort, the fire has not crossed the river and there is no advancement towards the community," according to a statement posted on Hydro's website at 10:40 p.m. Thursday. On Wednesday night, forestry officials ordered the hasty evacuation of Churchill Falls , a company town that exists to keep Hydro's generating station running. The massive plant provides power to the province and about 15 per cent of neighbouring Quebec's power. Dozens of people stayed behind in the community following the evacuation order to keep the plant operational. So far the fire hasn't reached the community. There are two major fires west of Churchill Falls, separated from the town only by the Churchill River. A midday update from N.L. Hydro said crews are working around the clock to keep the fire under control but there is no timeline for when residents of Churchill Falls might be able to return to the community. In an earlier interview with CBC News, provincial forest fire duty officer Bryan Oke said he hopes the river will help firefighters with their efforts. Forestry officials have also brought in sprinklers to help suppress fire around the town's facilities and protect property. At the moment, there is a crew of about 40 workers in the community to keep the power station operational , as well as police officers and firefighters. The statement added there is no immediate risk to the plant but the situation is being assessed. "There are many considerations in determining an approach to production should teams receive direction to evacuate, including spilling requirement and downstream impacts, asset protection, and remote monitoring capabilities." New fires burning According to the province's online wildfire dashboard, there are now 11 active fires burning in the province, up four from Thursday. There are three new fires in Labrador â€” at Atikonak Lake, Joseph Lake and Milner Lake West No. 2, all listed as burning out of control In addition, a new fire on Newfoundland's west coast, at South Branch, is listed as being held. Forest fire duty officer Mark Lawlor says the source of that fire is under investigation. He said the new fires have put a strain on available resources, which is why the province imposed a fire ban on much of the province . Lawlor said the fire threatening Churchill Falls is seven kilometres southwest of the community. There are smoking hot spots, open flames and burning trees, but four water bombers have been able to keep the fire to the south side of the river. "All in all, it was a success there," Lawlor said. There's another fire 17 kilometres away from the community, along the Trans-Labrador Highway. One of the main objectives, Lawlor said, is to keep that fire contained so they can keep the highway open. About 1,500 hectares are now burning, more than double the total size burning on Thursday. Lawlor blamed weather conditions, including high wind gusts and relative humidity dropping less than predicted. "It was a perfect storm that day," he said. The province has asked for additional support to fight the fires, including two water bombers from Quebec that arrived Thursday evening. Lawlor said an additional two water bombers from Ontario are arriving Friday, giving them eight in total. "I think we're in good shape with resources right now, much better shape than we were yesterday," he said. Help still available When the evacuation order came on Wednesday evening, several hundred people head to Happy Valley-Goose Bay where they registered at the YMCA. The emergency operations centre closed on Thursday evening after evacuees were able to find lodgings elsewhere, said fire Chief Brad Butler. However, their work helping those in need isn't over. "We're continuously assisting. I had a phone call from a provincial department last night for getting lodgings today for another family, which we're going to work on this morning," Butler told CBC News. With the emergency operations centre closed, people can call the 24-hour complaint line â€” 709-896-3322 â€” for assistance, he said. Butler hopes the people from Churchill Falls will be able to return as soon as possible. - Have you been affected by the evacuations in Churchill Falls? Cross Country Checkup is asking: When your city was faced with a crisis, what acts of kindness have you received or given? Fill out this form and you could have your comment read on the show. Convoy headed west While hundreds of people headed east toward Happy Valley-Goose Bay for safety Wednesday, a small number of people went west. Marlene Thompson, who was in a small group who headed for Labrador West, said she has family in the area and was told it was safe to go in that direction. "We're still trying to digest it. We don't really know what to expect at this point," she said. There were police officers checking in on evacuees arriving in Labrador West as well, she said. Thompson was at dinner with friends when the news arrived the town was being evacuated. They rushed home. "That's when I started throwing things into a suitcase. Just random things here and there," she said. She isn't sure if her clothes match or are for the summer, she added. "But I tried my best to take all of our life and throw it in a bag," she said. "It was harder than I thought it would be. But we managed to get it done, packed and on the road in like probably 30 minutes." Shane Ivany packed up his camper and travelled to Labrador City with his two children, two dogs and wife â€” who is seven months pregnant. A former firefighter, he said it's been a different experience to watch from the sidelines. "I was actually talking to the deputy chief there in Churchill yesterday, and he said 'You wish you were here, don't you?' And I said yeah, I kind of do. Cause it's in my blood, right? And firefighting is huge to me. And I know how hard it is and how extreme it can be," he said. "We're just waiting to get home. That's the hardest part." Download our free CBC News app to sign up for push alerts for CBC Newfoundland and Labrador. Click here to visit our landing page . With files from Peter Cowan, Darryl Dinn and Labrador Morning

author: alexmark
title: Kamala Harris lost the debate with herself last night. She might lose every state if voters see this.
text:
COULD USE A FEW DONATIONS! THANKS!
"The very word 'secrecy' is repugnant in a free and open society; and we are as a people inherently and historically opposed to secret societies, to secret oaths and to secret proceedings. We decided long ago that the dangers of excessive and unwarranted concealment of pertinent facts far outweighed the dangers which are cited to justify it. Even today, there is little value in opposing the threat of a closed society by imitating its arbitrary restrictions. Even today, there is little value in insuring the survival of our nation if our traditions do not survive with it." -- John F. Kennedy
